summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing Bureau of Prisons staff placed on administrative leave following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It identifies three staff members and a warden being reassigned, and clarifies the employment status and training of one staff member in response to media coverage.

keyFacts: Three Bureau of Prisons staff members were placed on administrative leave following Jeffrey Epstein's death: Correctional Officer Tovia Noel, Material Handler Foreman Michael Thomas, and a third Correctional Officer whose name is not fully provided.
Michael Thomas had previously served as a Correctional Officer for 7 years before moving to a warehouse job 5 years prior, and he volunteered for the overtime post in question.
The warden of the facility was reassigned as part of the response to Epstein's death.
The email clarifies that all BOP staff receive the same basic and annual training as correctional workers and are responsible for inmate care and custody.
The correspondence indicates media scrutiny regarding the qualifications and roles of staff involved in Epstein's custody at the time of his death.
